chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric T. Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to Adams County case 17CF10

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Associated with Charge #1

11:04 Defendant Eric T. Hall in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Eric T. Hall in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: plead to count 1, 6 month sentence concurrent to 17CF10 New Lisbon case, April 2018 release date, supervision end 2025 on other case, no restitution, victim's rights complied with. Parties agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  DEF PLEADS GUILTY.  Facts are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty. Froelich address the court. Atty Nelson addresses the court. Court orders: 6 months jail concurrent to prision sentence in Adams County case number 17CF10, $250 DNA surcharge. Appeal rights are given to the defendant 11:12
Plea hearing on October 10, 2017 at 11:00 am.

8:58 Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: get this set for a plea. Court agrees.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 10, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 9, 2017 at 08:45 am.
State's
Defendant's filed by Atty Nelson
Pre-trial conference on July 24, 2017 at 04:15 pm.
Status conference on September 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.

08:54 Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Defendant waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court.  The bond will continue as ordered.  Parties suggest setting plea in front of Judge Boles.

08:51 Defendant Eric T. Hall in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Eric T. Hall in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Liesl Nelson
Preliminary hearing on June 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.

The Court reviews the bond conditions with the defendant. Court verifies the DOB, address and phone # with the defendant.
***Def REFUSED***

04:10 Defendant Eric T. Hall in court, in custody VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ. Atty Liesl Nelson appears via phone for the defendant. Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich requests warrant be quashed. Court quashes warrant.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Froelich requests $7000 signature bond. Court orders $7000 signature bond. PDs office will be involved. Defendant has not been in the armed services. 04:20  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.
ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff.
